snippet: The United States has cut off financing to develop a Pakistani version of “Sesame Street” in response to accusations of corruption within the puppet theater working on the project.
abstract: United States cuts off financing for a $20 million project to develop a Pakistani version of children's television show Sesame Street; move comes in response to credible accusations of financial fraud and abuse within the local puppet theater working on the initiative.
lead_paragraph: The United States has cut off financing to develop a Pakistani version of “Sesame Street” in response to accusations of corruption within the puppet theater working on the project.

headline.main: Pakistan: U.S. Halts Financing for Pakistani ‘Sesame Street’
headline.print_headline: Pakistan: U.S. Halts Financing For Pakistani ‘Sesame Street’
